Welcome!
Dear Participant,{br}{br}You are being asked to be in a research study that is exploring how instructional designers prioritize their competencies based on their working experience. You are being invited because you are working in an instructional design related area with more than one year of experience. The potential participants for this study include instructional designers in higher education, consulting services, government, Kâ€“12, as well as those in the military. Your participation in this research is voluntary. If you choose to participate in this study, you will be asked to complete a Q sort survey that will take approximately 10-20 minutes to complete. {br}{br}{b}** Important Information **{/b}{br}If you agree with the consent form attached in the email, please click the button to continue.

Introduction
This study is about instructional designers' prioritization of competencies. Please sort these statements based on your working experience.
Step 1 of 5
Read the following statements carefully and split them up into three piles: a pile for statements you think are the most important, a pile for cards you think are the least important, and a pile for the rest.{br}{br}You can either drag the cards into one of the three piles or {b}press 1, 2, 3{/b} on your keyboard. Changes can be made later.{br}{br}If you want to read this instruction a second time, press the help-button at the bottom left corner.
Step 2 of 5
Take the cards from the "Most Important"-pile and arrange them on right side of the score sheet.{br}{br}Next, take the cards from the "Least Important"-pile and arrange them on the left side of the score sheet. Follow this procedure for all cards in the "Most Important"- and "Least Important"-piles.{br}{br}Finally, take the "Neutral"-cards and arrange them in the remaining open boxes of the score sheet.
